title: ‘Keep their light on in our world’: Daughter remembers Eastham couple who fell through ice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jerry and Kathleen Boucher, both in their 70s, died after falling through ice at Bee’s River in Eastham on Feb. 14.
Their daughter, Katy Boucher, shared a tribute on Facebook, highlighting her parents' commitment to community service.
A memorial service will be held at St. Joan of Arc Church in Orleans on Feb. 27-28; burial will be in West Hartford.

title: 3 fires being investigated as arson in Fitchburg, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Three recent fires in Fitchburg are under investigation as potential arson, State Fire Marshal Jon Davine announced.
Fires on Feb. 14 and 15 occurred in a large apartment building on Blossom and Day streets, officials reported.
A separate fire on Myrtle Avenue on Feb. 18 displaced seven people and injured one, but is considered unrelated.

title: Eric Dane, ‘Grey’s Anatomy’ star and ALS awareness advocate, dies at 53
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Eric Dane, known for 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria,' died at 53 from ALS, less than a year after diagnosis.
Dane, an ALS awareness advocate, announced his disease in 2025 and was named ALS Network's Advocate of the Year.
Dane is survived by his wife Rebecca Gayheart and daughters Billie and Georgia; his memoir to be published in 2026.

title: 4 Mass. State Police troopers charged in death of recruit suspended with pay
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Four Massachusetts State Police troopers charged in recruit Enrique Delgado-Garcia's death have been suspended with pay.
The troopers face manslaughter charges related to Delgado-Garcia's 2024 death from accidental blunt-force head injuries.
An independent review of state police training practices is nearing completion following the incident.

title: Braintree police warn public about planned ‘takeover’ at South Shore Plaza
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Braintree Police warned of a planned 'takeover' at South Shore Plaza on Friday evening, alerted by a social media post.
Police coordinated an operational plan with other law enforcement to ensure safety and monitor the event.
Past similar incidents involved street blockages, car stunts, and violence, prompting statewide preventative measures.

title: Kendrick Perkins has Celtics as ‘dark horse’ to win title in 2026 — under 1 condition
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kendrick Perkins views the Boston Celtics as potential 2026 champions if Jayson Tatum returns from injury.
Celtics are currently second in the Eastern Conference with a 35-19 record despite Tatum's absence this season.
Jaylen Brown is considered an MVP contender by Perkins, being top-five in scoring and defensive metrics.

title: What would it take for the Patriots to land AJ Brown? ESPN analyst cooked up a hypothetical trade.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: ESPN analyst proposed a Patriots trade for AJ Brown, involving first, third, sixth-round picks, and receiving a second-round pick.
AJ Brown, 28, had four consecutive 1,000-yard seasons and is under contract with the Eagles through 2029 at $96 million.
The hypothetical trade provides the Patriots an instant upgrade for their wide receiver group, despite his slightly reduced performance last season.

title: Why Kyle Pitts could be the Patriots’ top free-agent target
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots are considering tight end Kyle Pitts as a top free-agent target to boost their offense.
Pitts earned Second Team All-Pro honors in 2025, catching 88 passes for 928 yards with the Falcons.
Signing Pitts could offer a more budget-friendly option than pursuing wide receivers like Alec Pierce or A.J. Brown.

title: Provincetown man pleads guilty to possessing, distributing thousands of child porn files
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Laurence Pagnoni, 65, from Provincetown pleaded guilty to possession and distribution of child pornography in federal court.
The investigation began after a tip linked Pagnoni to distributing child pornography via the online platform MEGA.
Pagnoni faces up to 20 years in prison per charge, with sentencing scheduled for May 12, 2026.

title: Former Patriots QB Brian Hoyer shares family tragedy with ‘sudden’ death of sister-in-law
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Brian Hoyer announced the sudden death of his sister-in-law Carissa Rae Hoyer, aged 36, on February 13.
Hoyer's family launched a GoFundMe to support his brother Brett and his four daughters, surpassing their $100,000 goal.
Brian Hoyer, former Patriots quarterback, played for eight NFL teams from 2009 to 2023 and co-hosts 'The Quick Snap' podcast.
